criteria: Ability to write routinely over extended and shorter time frames for various tasks, purposes, and audiences.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of how to write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of how to write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences. There are significant gaps in their ability to apply these skills.

Student demonstrates a basic understanding of how to write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences. The application of these skills is inconsistent.

Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of how to write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences. There are occasional errors or omissions.

Student demonstrates a strong understanding of how to write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences. Their writing is generally clear and effective.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive and nuanced understanding of how to write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences. Their writing is consistently clear, effective, and tailored to the specific context.
